question_text: 1. Find the next figures in the figure pattern given below.
2. Complete the number pattern.

3. In the questions given below, the series with one or more
terms figures are missing marked with ‘?’. Choose the
correct option to replace the ‘?’ mark(s).
[A] 19
[B] 18
[C] 17
[D] 20

4. Number of the groups of 9 paper clips (
) shown here is
[A] 2
[B] 3
[C] 9
[D] 27

5. How many bananas are kept outside the basket?
[A] 1
[B] 2
[C] 3
[D] 4

6. A programme of children ended at the time shown on the
clock. At what time did the programme end?
[A] 6: 00
[B] 5: 20
[C] 7: 00
[D] None of these

7. Suresh had 112 bookmarks. He gives some bookmarks to her
pupils, he had 13 bookmarks left. How many bookmarks did
he give away?
[A] 110
[B] 125
[C] 99
[D] 130

8. Count and write the amount of money.
[A] Rs 70.00 [B] Rs 76.01
[C] Rs 75.40 [D] Rs 80.04

9. Six cats are numbered as follows:
Which cat shows the number lying between 40 and 50 and also
having 3 at ones place?

10. Sonia bought 45 candies. She gave 22 cookies to her sister.
How many candies are left with her?
[A] 42
[B] 23
[C] 50
[D] 43
11. Which of the following is greatest?

12. Write ‘+’ or ‘–’ in each
to complete the number
sentence.
[A] +, +
[B] +, –
[C] –, –
[D] –, +

13.
Object _______________ is the heaviest.
[A] 3
[B] 5
[C] 4
[D] 1
Direction (Q.No.14 & 15): Study the diagram below and
answer the questions 14 and 15.
4 cm
A
B
3 cm
D
C
10 cm

14. The length of BD is 1 cm less than the total length of AB
and AD.
CD is __________ cm longer than BD.
[A] 5
[B] 4
[C] 8
[D] 9

15. The length of CD is twice that of BC. What is the length of
all the sides of triangle BCD?
[A] 15 cm
[B] 31 cm
[C] 42 cm
[D] 38 cm

16. Which of the following clocks shows 30 minutes after 4
O’clock?

17. Sent gold High School has 453 students. It has 23 more
students than kiddy gold High School. How many students
does kiddy gold High School have?
[A] 400
[B] 430
[C] 403
[D] 340

18. Tanshu spent Rs 35.70 on a ball and Rs 50.30 on a toy car.
How much did he spend altogether?
[A] Rs 80
[B] Rs 85
[C] Rs 58
[D] Rs 86
19. Which tree has apples more than 6 but less than 9?
20. Which abacus shows 15 – 13 = 13?
21. Which of the following is smallest?

22. 6 hundreds 3 tens 2 ones – 3 hundreds 2 tens 6 ones =
____________.
[A] 306
[B] 360
[C] 603
[D] 305

23.
What does
stand for ?
[A] 7
[B] 5
[C] 3
[D] 4

24. A number bond is shown below.
What is the value of M × N?
[A] 35
[B] 43
[C] 52
[D] 25

25. Tanya has following two pencils.
Find the total length of both the pencils.
[A] 7 units
[B] 6 units
[C] 5 units
[D] 9 units

26. There were 298 hens and cows on a farm.
There were 153 hens.
How many cows were there?
[A] 138
[B] 140
[C] 145
[D] 144

27. Write the correct time for the clock shown below.
[A] 5 : 15
[B] 5 : 40
[C] 6 : 20
[D] 3 : 20

28. Sumit has following flowers and balloons.
Which statement is true?
[A] Flowers are more than balloons.
[B] Flowers are equal to balloons.
[C] Flowers are less than balloons
[D] Balloons are 2 more than flowers.

29. A bag of rice weighs 3 kg. How much do 6 bags of rice
weight?
[A] 18 kg
[B] 24 kg
[C] 15 kg
[D] 17 kg

30. If only all Saturdays and Sundays are holidays, then in the
month of December 2014 how many holidays will we get?
[A] 6
[B] 8
[C] 10
[D] 7

31. How much do the counters add up to?
[A] 253
[B] 235
[C] 325
[D] 532

32. The packet of rice has a mass of _______________ kg.
Flour
[A] 9
[B] 15
[C] 18
[D] 12

33. Fill in the blank:
The book is ________________ the lamp.
[A]Equal to
[B] Lighter than
[C] Heavier than [D] None of these

34. Which of the following is the CORRECT way of writing 8
less than 14?
[A] 14 – 8 = 6
[B] 14 + 8 = 6
[C] 14 – 6 = 8
[D] 14 + 6 = 8

35. Tonu gave Rs 50 to buy this ball. How much money will he
get back?
[A]  Rs 15
[B]Rs  25
[C]   Rs 20
[D]   Rs 17
